meta.title: Session 08: MS Word Insert, Draw & Design Tabs
meta.description: Comprehensive coverage of MS Word's Insert Tab (Tables, Illustrations, Header/Footer), Draw Tab features, and Design Tab (Page Backgrounds), plus AI tools Freepik and Evernote.

questions.question: Which tab in MS Word allows you to insert a Table, Picture, or Header?
questions.explanation: The Insert Tab contains all commands for adding elements like tables, images, and headers to the document.

questions.question: You want to combine three cells in a table into one single cell. Which command should you use from the Table Layout tab?
questions.explanation: Merge Cells combines two or more selected cells into a single larger cell.

questions.question: What is a 'Watermark' in MS Word?
options: A wet stain on the paper
Faint text or image that appears behind the document content
questions.explanation: A Watermark is used to indicate document status (e.g., 'Confidential', 'Draft') and appears faintly behind the text.

questions.question: Which AI-powered platform is described as a 'Creative Asset Companion' for finding vector graphics and photos?
questions.explanation: Freepik is a popular resource for finding free vectors, stock photos, and PSD files for creative projects.

questions.question: Which visual tool in the Insert tab is best for creating organizational charts or process cycles?
questions.explanation: SmartArt allows you to quickly create professional diagrams like lists, processes, cycles, and hierarchies.

questions.question: What is the keyboard shortcut to insert a Hyperlink?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + K opens the Insert Hyperlink dialog box.

questions.question: In the Draw tab, what does the 'Ink to Shape' feature do?
options: Converts rough hand-drawn shapes into perfect geometric shapes
questions.explanation: Ink to Shape recognizes freehand drawings (like a rough circle) and snaps them into clean, perfect vector shapes.

questions.question: Where can you find the option to add a decorative border around the entire page?
questions.explanation: The Page Borders command is located in the Page Background group of the Design tab.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a 'Drop Cap'?
options: To make the first letter of a paragraph very large (spanning multiple lines)
To drop the text to the next page
questions.explanation: A Drop Cap is a large capital letter at the beginning of a text block that has the depth of two or more lines of regular text.

questions.question: Which Insert Tab group contains the 'Equation' and 'Symbol' commands?
questions.explanation: The Symbols group is specifically for inserting mathematical equations and special characters not found on the keyboard.

questions.question: What is Evernote primarily used for?
options: Taking, organizing, and syncing notes across devices
questions.explanation: Evernote is a note-taking application designed to capture and organize ideas, lists, and projects.

questions.question: To add a repeating logo or page number at the bottom of every page, you should use:
questions.explanation: A Footer is the section at the bottom of a page used for recurring content like page numbers.

questions.question: Which command in the Insert Tab allows you to take a picture of an open window on your desktop and insert it into Word?
questions.explanation: The Screenshot tool allows you to quickly clip parts of your screen or insert full windows of open applications.

questions.question: In a table, if text is touching the borders too closely, which setting in the Layout tab should you adjust?
questions.explanation: Cell Margins control the amount of empty space (padding) between the cell border and the text inside.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a group in the Insert Tab?
questions.explanation: The Clipboard group (Cut, Copy, Paste) is located in the Home Tab, not the Insert Tab.

questions.question: What does the 'WordArt' feature do?
options: Applies decorative effects (shadows, outlines, gradients) to text
questions.explanation: WordArt is a gallery of text styles that you can add to your documents to create decorative effects.

questions.question: If you want to jump to a specific section within the same document, which feature should you use in combination with a Hyperlink?
questions.explanation: A Bookmark marks a specific place in your document; you can then hyperlink to that Bookmark to jump there instantly.

questions.question: Which tab would you use to change the 'Page Color' of your document?
questions.explanation: The Design Tab focuses on the overall look of the document, including Page Color and Themes.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to leave a note or feedback on a document without changing the actual text?
questions.explanation: Comments appear in the margin (balloons) and are used for feedback, questions, or notes to other authors.

questions.question: In the Draw tab, what tool allows you to select and move ink drawings?
questions.explanation: The Lasso Select tool allows you to circle around ink strokes to select them for moving or resizing.
